conclusion: The p-T graph shows a linear relationship between pressure (p) and temperature (T).
At 200 K, the pressure is 0.5 × 10⁵ Pa; at 400 K, the pressure is 1.0 × 10⁵ Pa.
Calculate the slope (m) as 0.25 × 10³ Pa/K using the pressure and temperature values.
Formulate the linear equation p = mT + c and find c = 0 using the point (200 K, 0.5 × 10⁵ Pa).
The equation of the line is p = 0.25 × 10³ × T.
Calculate the pressure at 600 K as 1.5 × 10⁵ Pa using the equation.
The pressure of the gas when the temperature is 600 K is 1.5 × 10⁵ Pa.
